oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1942-12-12 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from December 12, 1942. Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Bashful Brother Oswald, Rachel Veach, Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys and Blue Grass Quartet, Pap's Jug Band, Mac McGar, and Howdy Forrester. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Mac McGar; Bill Monroe; Blue Grass Quartet; Pap's Jug Band; Roy Acuff; Howdy Forrester
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Prince Albert commercial (Bashful Brother Oswald) -- George D. Hay introduces Mac McGar -- Katy Hill (Mac McGar) -- Louie Buck talks -- George D. Hay introduces Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Quartet -- Did You Ever Go Sailing (Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Quartet) -- Prince Albert commercial (George D. Hay, Louie Buck) -- George D. Hay introduces Pap's Jug Band -- I Want A Girl (Just Like The Girl That Married Dear Old Dad) (Pap's Jug Band) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff -- How Beautiful Heaven Must Be (Roy Acuff) -- George D. Hay introduces Howdy Forrester -- Sally Gooden (Howdy Forrester) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff -- Ida Red (Roy Acuff) -- Closing statement (George D. Hay, Bashful Brother Oswald)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Bashful Brother Oswald; Veach, Rachel; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Pap's Jug Band; Wilson, Lonnie; Forrester, Howdy, 1922-1987; McGar, Mac; Monroe, Bill, 1911-1996; Blue Grass Boys
